CodeExample.Title: Get the drive/root entity
CodeExample.Summary: To get a drive/root drive/root resource, submit an HTTP GET request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request: GET /<version>/myOrganization/drives/<drive.id>/root HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose

Remarks.string: A successful response returns the 200 OK status code and a body containing an item resource representation.

CodeExample.Title: Create a drive/root entity
CodeExample.Summary: To create a drive/root resource, submit an HTTP POST request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request:
POST /<version>/myOrganization/drives/<drive.id>/root HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <item.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <item.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: The request body must contain the properties required to create a root resource related to the drive entity. The successful response returns a 201 Created status code, with a payload containing the newly created root resource representation.

CodeExample.Title: Update a drive/root entity
CodeExample.Summary: To update a drive/root resource, submit an HTTP PUT request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request:
PUT /<version>/myOrganization/drives/<drive.id>/root HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*' Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <item.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <item.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: The request body must contain properties without default values. The successful response returns a 204 No content status code, without any payload.

CodeExample.Title: Modify a drive/root entity
CodeExample.Summary: To modify a root resource, submit an HTTP PATCH request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request:
PATCH /<version>/myOrganization/drives/<drive.id>/root HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*' Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <item.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <item.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: The request body contains the to-be-modified properties with new values. The successful response returns a 204 No content status code, without any payload.

CodeExample.Title: Delete a drive/root entity
CodeExample.Summary: To delete a root resource, submit an HTTP DELETE request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request: DELETE /<version>/myOrganization/drives/<drive.id>/root HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*'

Remarks.string: The request contains no payload. The successful response returns a 204 No content status code, also without any payload.
